laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal serum TSH level (1.6 mU/liter; reference 0.5–5.0) and normal free T4 level (0.9 ng/dl; reference 0.9–1.8), slightly high Tg level (31 ng/ml; reference /H1102130).
15-mm hypoechogenic solid nodule in the mid right lobe.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 40 yr, showed three nodules in the left lobe along with scattered hypoechogenic foci in the thyroid parenchyma.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Follicular cells with enlarged nuclei and condensed chromatin, suggesting malignancy.
Detected PAX8 mutation (c.238_252dup, p.K80_A84dup) in lymphocytes, but the level of the mutant allele was significantly lower than that of the wild-type allele, indicating a somatic mosaic state.
Thyroid tissue showed hypercellular lesions with absent or very small follicles resembling fetal thyroid in late developmental phase.
Fetal-like tissue carried the PAX8 mutation in a heterozygous state, whereas normal tissue and adenoma tissue did not.
